item.title: Large fridge dumped on pavementon obstructing the path for the public. Located at 296-298 Brixton road SW9 6AG., 12th June
item.description:
A large fridge has been dumped on the pavement outside the building 296-298 Brixton road SW9. The fridge is obstucting the path for public use. It has been here for a little over a week. Please can it be removed. Very close by on Robstart Street SW9 another similar Size fridge has been dumped by a park entrance.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thornton Street, Brixton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping near Whitewebbs, 12th June
item.description:

item.title: Overgrown conifer and buddleia blocking path & causing fire risk, 12th June
item.description:
There is an enormous overgrown conifer and buddleia in the garden of 42 Granby Road which is covering the alleyway between Granby Road and Arsenal Road. The alleyway is a popular rubbish-dumping ground and also a place for teenagers to smoke. One thrown cigarette-end could send the whole place up, as it is dry as a tinder box. There is also a small electric substation of some sort hidden in there, which must pose an additional fire risk.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Granby Road, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Emergency: dangerous sink hole, 12th June
item.description:
This looks to be a sink hole that has hollowed out under the street. Someone has unwisely parked their car on top of it. A small section of the road has collapsed but this could extend under the surface and may be dangerous

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Crystal Palace Road, East Dulwich, London

item.title: Illegal use of traffic cones, 12th June
item.description:
The property has a driveway, that holds two cars only 1 drop pavement for entering. 2 cars can park past the drop but owner puts out traffic cones to prevent parking on the public road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arbroath Road, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hanging vegetation and litter, 12th June
item.description:
This parking space has not been maintained for long time. There is hanging vegetation now blocking access to the pavement, the parking space is full of trees and vegetation, litter and other kind of nasty stuff. It must be fixed asap. This gets reported every year, the owner doesn't do anything to fix it. In 2021 was sorted by someone from the council but so far nothing else has been done.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Victoria Street, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Big pothole on turn, middle of carriageway, 12th June
item.description:
There is big pothole just as you pass Purple Willows nursery on Woolwich road, Erith direction. This is in the middle of the carriage way, and there are always car parked on the road too. It's very dangerous since the pothole it's on a road elbow with limited visibility.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Erith Road, Lessness Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Van on pavement and someone living inside, 12th June
item.description:
Hi, just reporting someone parked on the pavement and apparently living inside the van. Could you please check this asap?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Victoria Street, Upper Belvedere, London
